channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: The peak interest rate era is over. Here's what investors are watching
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is about to join the European Central Bank, the Bank of England, the People's Bank of China and others in cutting key rates.

item.title: Asia markets mixed after China manufacturing slumps to 6-month low; CSI 300 hits 7-month low
item.description: Among the economic data coming out from major markets in the region this week are inflation data from South Korea and Australia's second-quarter GDP data

item.title: Defense stocks in an ESG portfolio? A profound — and controversial — shift seems to be underway
item.description: The idea of including defense stocks in sustainably-minded portfolios remains controversial.

item.title: China's manufacturing output swung back to modest growth in August, private survey finds
item.description: China's factory activity has shown modest growth among smaller manufacturers, as exporting orders offset the weakening domestic consumption.

item.title: China's first global gaming hit sells millions in a week. An early investor shares what's next
item.description: China's first attempt at a top-tier video game has smashed world records, bolstering the industry's global ambitions after Beijing's gaming crackdown.

item.title: BYD sales hit a record in August despite broader China EV slowdown
item.description: Chinese electric car giant BYD sold a record number of passenger vehicles in August, with sales of hybrids growing faster than those of battery-only cars.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Soft landing in sight?
item.description: With tamer inflation, hotter economy, stable jobs market, there are signs that the economy's cleared for a soft landing.

item.title: Macao did it. Singapore too. Now Thailand looks to build casinos to attract tourist dollars
item.description: If the law gets passed, Thailand could be Macao and Singapore's largest competitor by the end of the decade, industry watchers told CNBC.

item.title: Here’s how much athletes at the Paris Paralympics earn for winning medals
item.description: While the International Paralympic Committee does not dole out prize money for winning medals, several countries do reward their athletes with medal bonuses.

item.title: Has Boeing shaken your confidence to fly? A new MIT study could restore it
item.description: Boeing's ongoing quality control issues have rattled traveler confidence. But a new study from MIT says flying is getting safer by the decade.

item.title: What's stalling China's stock market recovery, according to KraneShares' CIO
item.description: With investors fleeing Chinese stocks over growth concerns, the case for fiscal intervention could be stronger than ever.

item.title: NBC ripped up its Olympics playbook for 2024 — so far, the new strategy paid off
item.description: NBCUniversal's bet on the Olympics paid off in Paris this summer, for the company as a whole, but also its streaming platform Peacock.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sells more Bank of America, has now cut stake by nearly 15%
item.description: Warren Buffett has added around $6 billion to Berkshire Hathaway's sizable cash pile this summer with a string of Bank of America stock sales since mid-July.

item.title: The sneaky way Big Tech is acquiring AI unicorns without buying the companies
item.description: Google, Microsoft, Amazon and others have been quietly poaching coveted talent from AI startups, without actually acquiring the companies.

item.title: The 'rent-first' lifestyle is catching on. From cars to clothes and even caskets, here's when it makes sense to buy vs. rent
item.description: Younger adults are showing a preference for the renting lifestyle, studies show. In some cases, it also makes financial sense.

item.title: Alibaba shares rise after it completes three-year regulatory overhaul
item.description: Alibaba has completed a three-year regulatory "rectification" process after an antitrust fine it received in 2021, China's market regulator said Friday.

item.title: A look at the behind-the-scenes business of Hollywood studio lot tours
item.description: Universal, Warner Bros., Sony and Paramount use tours to show off the movie-making process from set design and sound recording to costumes and props.

item.title: China's robotaxi push sparks job loss fears among drivers. Experts say it can create new jobs too
item.description: Experts say that new technology often displaces jobs when it enters the market, but it can also create new jobs.

item.title: You can buy mansions in these Mediterranean countries for the price of a studio in New York
item.description: Manhattan real estate is notoriously expensive. You can trade in your 500 sq ft condo in the city for a 7,000 sq ft home in Sicily, according to My Dolce Casa.

item.title: Warren Buffett leads Berkshire Hathaway to new heights at age 94
item.description: "It's been a matter of a well thought out strategy prosecuted for seven decades with discipline, consistency, and unusual insight," Oaktree's Howard Marks said.

item.title: Brazil's top court orders nationwide suspension of Elon Musk's X
item.description: Brazil’s supreme court on Friday ordered a nationwide suspension of Elon Musk’s social network X after the company vowed to defy earlier court orders.

item.title: The Bank of Japan is certain to raise rates further. The question is when
item.description: BOJ is widely seen to stick to its monetary policy tightening campaign, but many markets participants remain divided over the timing of the next hike.

item.title: Where are low-cost airlines cutting back now? New planes
item.description: Some discount and low-cost airlines are looking to put off big expenses on

item.title: FDA authorizes Novavax’s updated Covid vaccine, paving way for fall rollout
item.description: The decision comes only a week after it approved a new round of messenger RNA shots from Pfizer and Moderna, which both target an offshoot of JN.1 called KP.2.

item.title: Spain is the No. 1 country for digital nomads in 2024—see the full top 10 list
item.description: The Global Digital Nomad Report looked into 12 factors across five categories to rank the best global destinations for digital nomads.

item.title: This 29-year-old from one of London's poorest neighborhoods became a millionaire after selling his influencer marketing firm
item.description: Timothy Armoo grew up poor on a council estate in South London. Here's how he became a millionaire before the age of 30.

item.title: China’s Zeekr targets global markets with its electric SUV, priced to undercut Tesla’s Model Y
item.description: China's electric vehicle company, Zeekr, announced Friday that it will launch its first SUV in China on Sep. 20, starting at US$33,700, to compete with Tesla.

item.title: Amazon checkout process hits technical snag during Labor Day sale
item.description: Amazon customers posted complaints on social media about not being able to complete purchases ahead of the Labor Day weekend on Friday.

item.title: European stocks end August at record high after volatile start to the month
item.description: European markets closed higher on Friday, the last trading day of August, as investors weighed key inflation data from across the region.

item.title: Euro zone inflation falls to 3-year low of 2.2%, backing September rate cut case
item.description: Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a decline to 2.2% in August, down from 2.6% in July.
